body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of the State of Kentucky.

The undersigned Would ask your interposition in favor of Stephen Hicks who was found at the December June Term 1863 of Hardin Circuit Court said Hicks was fined Sixty Dollars for keeping a tipling House. The facts are these Martin Hardin had a license to keep a Tavern at Stephensburg & let his Bar to Hicks & Hicks sold liquors therein & for this was fined for Keeping Tipling House. Hicks sold in good faith & We would ask your excellency to remit said fine.
Dec 1863

Wm. T. Samuels Trustee Jury
Fund Hardin Co.
Sam Haycraft Clk
James Stuart Judge
Hicks sold the whiskey in a house belonging to Hardin but not connected by walls & was innocently involved
The Shrff. M. Hardin has paid me Eighteen Dollars, being that portion of the fine that was due me -- Jno. Chapeze Comlth's Atty.

Hardin Cir Ct
vs
Stephen Hicks
Petition
$60
Tipling

Remit except fees & costs
T. E. Bramlette
